de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.processor.runtime.module.model
Interface IFunctionRegistry

All Known Implementing Classes:
FunctionRegistry, FunctionRegistry, FunctionRegistryImpl
public interface IFunctionRegistry

Internal registry for function classes. Provides access to registered functions and enables the registration of new functions.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Summary
 java.lang.Class<? extends IFunction> getFunction(java.lang.String itemIdentifier)
          Method returns the stored interpreter class for a TMQL function identifies by the given identifier.
 boolean isKnownFunction(java.lang.String identifier)
          Method checks if the given identifier is used as identification of a registered function.
 void registerFunction(java.lang.String itemIdentifier, java.lang.Class<? extends IFunction> interpreter)
          Register a new function in the TMQL engine.
 

Method Detail

registerFunction

void registerFunction(java.lang.String itemIdentifier,
                      java.lang.Class<? extends IFunction> interpreter)
Register a new function in the TMQL engine. Please note that only registered functions can be used in context of a TMQL query.

Parameters:
itemIdentifier - the identifier of the function
interpreter - the interpreter class of the new function

getFunction

java.lang.Class<? extends IFunction> getFunction(java.lang.String itemIdentifier)
Method returns the stored interpreter class for a TMQL function identifies by the given identifier. If the identifier is relative the runtime tries to resolve the absolute IRI.

Parameters:
itemIdentifier - the function identifier
Returns:
the interpreter class if the identifier is known, null otherwise

isKnownFunction

boolean isKnownFunction(java.lang.String identifier)
Method checks if the given identifier is used as identification of a registered function.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier
Returns:
true if the identifier is known as function, false otherwise
